definition: to go downhill/to decline/to slump
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
slope/CL:個|个[ge4]/sloping/slanted
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: China's mammoth economy may be downshifting.
sentences.chinese: 而規模龐大的中國經濟也可能在走下坡路。

sentences.english: After that, it is often downhill.
sentences.chinese: 這之後，就常常是走下坡路了。

sentences.english: They mean that you’re past your best and are now in decline.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着你已經過了你的巔峯時期現在在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Tourism are down and many hotels are operating in the red.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊業在走下坡路，許多酒店慘淡經營，入不敷出。

sentences.english: The so-called movie queen is going downhill.
sentences.chinese: 那位所謂提電影皇后現已在走下坡路了。

sentences.english: The customs figures show a steady decline in British trade.
sentences.chinese: 關稅數字表明英國的貿易一直在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Huangshi clothing industry has made brilliant achievements while nowadays is on the decline.
sentences.chinese: 黃石市的服裝業曾經有過輝煌，但如今卻在走下坡路。

sentences.english: It reveals the slope on which the AAUP now finds itself.
sentences.chinese: 它暴露了全美大學教授聯合會正在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Now teenagers always have thought that 30-year-olds are over the hill.
sentences.chinese: 現在年輕人總是以爲30歲後就會開始走下坡路。

sentences.english: And what's interesting is that the figure gose steadily downhill.
sentences.chinese: 而且有趣的是，這個數字會一直走下坡路。

sentences.english: In my opinion, Jenson has gone down because of the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，簡森在壓力下已經開始走下坡路了。

sentences.english: After the movie Ashes of Time, later such new-version knight-errant films gradually declined.
sentences.chinese: 《東邪西毒》之後，新武俠電影開始走下坡路。

sentences.english: Today, it appears to be leading the way back down.
sentences.chinese: 而如今，房產業倒是引領着走下坡路了。

sentences.english: But then these efforts began to go downhill.
sentences.chinese: 之後，這些努力就開始走下坡路。

sentences.english: The AAUP has many branches at different colleges and universities in the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 它暴露了全美大學教授聯合會正在走下坡路。

definition: downhill road/(fig.) downhill path
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
to steadily deteriorate
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
things are not as good as they used to be
to decline/to wane/to decay/to deteriorate
recession (in economics)
to decline/to wane
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
flourishing age (of the ceremonial tripod)/golden age
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
